key_points: A memorial service for former Gen. Colin Powell will be held on Nov. 5 at the Washington National Cathedral.
The service will be by invitation only with limited seating, according to Peggy Cifrino's statement.
The event is scheduled to start at noon.
Powell died due to complications from COVID-19, despite being vaccinated.
He suffered from multiple myeloma, a condition that affects the immune system.
Powell also had early-stage Parkinson’s disease.
He was 84 years old at the time of his passing.
The National Cathedral has hosted services for notable figures such as former President George H.W. Bush and Sen. John McCain.
Powell had a 35-year career in the Army, holding various significant positions.
He was the first Black Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff and the first Black Secretary of State.
